html:
7.4.23  1:15 am   I'm going to turn 20 in 1 day. How did you feel when you turned 20?

      i was discovering many things philosophically and linguistically, and also musically, but that had nothing to do with the number 20. the age 20 was the normalest part of the way i was feeling at that time

7.4.23  12:32 am   Cab you explain the Pythagorean theorem
For me

      sure. imagine a square, 1 inch wide and 1 inch tall. area is 1 (because 1x1=1).But how long is it diagonally? (wtf) longer than 1.... shorter than 2........ not 1 and a half........ what the heck is that number? got to be a super normal number, but it doesn't even seem to be in the same world as the 1. Anyway, try this: cut it along the diagonal to make 2 triangles. now take a second square and cut that one the same way. so now you have 4 triangle pieces. now rearrange those 4 triangles to make 1 big square. now you see, ... the height and length of the new big square is that ? mystery value from before. the area of the new big square is, of course 2. because you built this out of 2 original triangles which each had area 1. So what's the height/width of the 2 area square? in other words, what's the square root of 2? anyway, it's something point weirdsomething, but now you know a fun fact about the original 1x1 square, and what the heck that weird diagonal length was. indeed, it's the square root of 2. that should get you started

7.3.23  6:02 pm   hi bill! the very end of "at the airport terminal" reminds me of a propeller slowing down. is that intentional?

      it's an intentional sound, but i'm not sure if i made the connection to airplanes. indeed, many songs coming to a safe landing at the end will feel like an airplane. i'm generally aware of this, but i feel this way about many songs. not just the ones that mention airplanes in the lyrics specifically

7.3.23  5:15 pm   do you "practice" on your instruments?

     i use them for music. the way you use language for speaking

     do you spend time on "basic" things like scales and arpeggios?

     i don't use scales or arpegios. i use the notes as desired

     do you practice in general or just spend more time making music (or doing other things that you want to be good at)? 

     i use music and language, among other things, as expression

7.3.23  4:42 pm   Why do we use Welp instead of Well?

      the 'p' is the sound of your hands slapping down after a good shrug. if you are in text message then you must convey this phonetically

      all

     no, but sometimes it's pretty cool

7.2.23  12:03 am   what are some good chords for making a listener feel strange

      different chords do different things in different situations. just like letters. For example, i can give you a situation where the letter "L" would make someone feel strange. Let's say you saw, in one of the many countries where 'STOP' signs exist, you see a stop sign that clearly says 'SLOP', and it's not a graffiti modification, it actually appears to be a real stop sign, placed in a legitimate place where a stop sign would be expected, and in every way it looks to be an authentic genuine stopsign manufactured by the official sign-making department. but it says "SLOP" instead of "STOP". Similarly, it would be equally strange if, when playing the song 'YMCA' in the key of F#, if, for the first chord of the chorus, a C chord was used
